reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: As a result of a sudden flight cancellation by Ryanair, in the middle of the night, the entire plane load of passengers were accommodated by the Barcelo hotel in Malaga I can only thank the manager and staff of this great hotel for their kindness, understanding and efficiency at such a frustrating, tiring and disappointing time for the weary passengers. The staff could not do enough for us. They were very well trained in customer care and happy and smiling throughout our stay. This included the front of house and the dining room staff as well as the maitre'd and the hotel manager. The bedrooms are beautiful, and comfortable. They made our stay into a lovely experience from what had become a nightmare at the airport. Thank you to all the lovely staff at the Barcelo Hotel in Malaga.
reviews.title: Well done!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Very modern and clean, with helpful friendly staff, however no great lounge area to relax in at night, a bit far out from the old town ( stayed with my friend who is nearly 80! ), but a great taxi service from the back of the hotel, for 5euro or so leaves you at the main Latinos st and all the lovely shops. Got a taxi from the airport to the hotel costing 20 euro, but got the train back costing 3 euro 50 .! Only 3stops from the hotel . There's a great bus , train , and taxi service from this hotel so getting around is no problem. The only negative thing is the lack of a pool and somewhere and relax at night. If you visit Malaga and want to be in the hub of things stay closer to the center but if you want a nice quiet weekend stay at the Barcelo. Don't forget to try the slide from the first floor it's a must!!
reviews.title: A clean and quiet hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very handy for the train station so for people traveling through or business travelers this is a great hotel. For tourists (such as me) the hotel is approx a 10 minute walk through a somewhat commercial area before getting to the tourist "zone".
reviews.title: Average for tourists, above average for business travelers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk staff were friendly but didn't seem as knowledgable about tourist type things as other hotels we have stayed at.
reviews.title: Expectations met and exceeded

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: So I would recommend this hotel for business travelers but vacationers may want to consider its location.
reviews.title: Very good except for the location
Ideally Situuated for Travellers
reviews.text: Ideally situated for travellers it adjoins the city's main railway station. It is, however, superbly soundproofed and there is no noise pollution. The old town is a short stroll away. The rooms are spacious and well equipped and present excellent value for money. The staff are attentive and helpful and the facility to leave luggage for a short while after checking out was very gratefully utilised. There was nothing to fault and a return is guaranteed.

reviews.title: Excellent gym, away from the tourist traps
reviews.text: Stayed here for six days in August 2012. Took a small suite to be able to work in the hotel room. Had everything I needed. Free and fast Internet, excellent gym that opens at 7, but that are willing to open if you want to start earlier. Staff very friendly (I was a bit uncertain what to expect based on reviews on Tripadvisor). Bathroom very good, with great rainfall shower. Gym is extremely new, somewhat smaller than older pictures on the web suggest because of mirror. But was very happy with it. Also handy that the hotel is next to the central station shopping mall and adjacent to a residential neighborhood and a few minutes away from the beach. Had excellent lunches in direct neighborhood for 6-12 euros depending on whether I took coffee and starter with it.recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chose this hotel as we were arriving by train and picking up hire car from the station. Room was reasonably comfortable but nothing particuarly special. The "design" aspect was looking a little tired and dated, and the sliding glass bathroom door was a bit annoying. Check in/out easy and staff in general friendly and efficient. Gym was a bit small but better than nothing. City centre around 20 mins walk.
reviews.title: Ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Connections

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: We used the Barcelo Malaga for one night, as we were headed to Granada for our main stay, and wanted somewhere convenient and cheap to stay overnight, before making our connecting bus link the following morning. The rail link from the airport is extremely simple to use, and stops right at the hotel, whereupon you can get rail links to other parts of Spain and Malaga centre, or simply cross the road to the bus station if you prefer that. The reception staff were excellent, polite and efficient. The room very spacious, clean and modern, well equipped and very quiet. Breakfast the following morning was sumptuous, very varied choice indeed, and plentiful. Only downside to our one night, and probably just an issue at that time, but the staff at the bar need to be more attentive, and keep an eye open for customers, instead of vanishing behind the scenes for long periods of time.
reviews.title: Vert nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely hotel in a very good location - above the railway station, with a shopping centre, bowling alley and a variety of restaurants and only 3 stops from the airport.
reviews.title: Gotta love the slide!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had a really warm welcome (even though we arrived 3 hours early). The rooms were large and clean with very comfortable beds (sheets were a little to well starched, but I'm not going to complain as they were very clean). There was a seperate bathroom with a great power shower, big towels and complimentary toiletries. Breakfast was good with lots of choice. Decoration throughout the hotel was 'unique' with some great features. However, the highlight of my stay was definately the slide from the first to the ground floor - I was like a child for the day getting the lift from the 6th to the 1st floor then the slide down to the ground - everytime I left the hotel I had a big smile on my face ;0)
reviews.title: Handy Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all we had a very comfortable night in a lovely hotel.
reviews.title: Fairly inexpensive - unique for a chain hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotels best point is its handy location directly adjacent to main train station; fast links to basically the rest of Spain can be easily achieved.
reviews.title: Very nice city hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice functional hotel clean comfortable, wi fi did not work in my room but was given Ethernet cable by front desk so sorted. I did find the bar in hotel a very strange concept as I had to ask where to get a drink and coffee and was asked to wait in area by reception and someone appeared from behind door to take my order and returned with my coffee and drink, I was the only person in this modern space ship environment and not surprised as it did feel rather unwelcoming. All personnel polite as professional, excellent breakfast selection.
reviews.title: Very modern, clean, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Great room. Nice design. Most comfortable bed of all the hotel I stayed on in Spain
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Location. Close to everything except to the town central, but public transport are abundant. Supermarket just across the hotel
reviews.title: Hotel Barcelo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff Friendly and helpful
reviews.title: Excellent modern hotel for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only complaint is that the Air conditioner in my room cannot be set below 23", so the room can get a bit stuffy. Inform the staff, but they said it was preset
reviews.title: A mixed bag.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good:
reviews.title: Convenient contemporary hotel with some quirks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: hotel says: free wifi
reviews.title: disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: in reality: wifi signal only strong enough to use in business centre.
reviews.title: Fun city break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel appears to have lovely rooms.
reviews.title: Perfectly placed for train/bus stations - and a great breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: In reality: no free bottle of water as one would expect really and room is quite shoddily constructed (door is wonky, tap in bathroom is wonky, tiles don't meet up properly).
reviews.title: Great hotel - lovely stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Nice bar, but empty and souless. Dining room may have nice food but was closed. Whole of the lounge/bar area was empty.
reviews.title: Quirky modern hotel at an excellent price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife had her passport stolen in Seville which meant we had to travel by train to Malaga to visit the British Consul. We chose this hotel over the internet because it was literally on top of the station and close to the consulate. At 89 euros for the night (without breakfast) it was fair value as the hotel is very modern and clean. Reception staff were very helpful and let us use their computer (the one in the Business Centre was down). We did not have breakfast, but there is a huge food mall by the hotel and at the station which would meet the needs of just about anyone.
reviews.title: Modern, efficient and close to station and British Consul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was quiet on a Sunday night and I dont think many were staying there. There are not many facilities, other than bar and restaurant, as it is very much a business conference hotel. There is no intrusion from the station.
reviews.title: Quirky in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We could not have chosen a better location and hotel given our circumstances, but someone on a tourist trip might prefer to be nearer the centre of town which is a 20 minute walk away.
reviews.title: Perfect in every way !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Ultra modern style hotel in great location with one exit right into Maria Zambrano rail station.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at 8.45am hoping we could leave luggage until we checked in later in the day. To great surprise we were in our room five minutes later!
reviews.title: Particularly Good For Onward Travel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Hotel is very conveniently located by the central train station. Very modern hotel with excellent interior design. Stayed here during the day while waiting for a flight, but managed to enjoy it! Staff is very nice, all runs smoothly. Historical centre is located some 15 minutes walk or 5 minutes drive away. Some nice restaurants are located nearby, but train station building features an abundance of shopping facilities. You will definitely enjoy it!
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is ideal if travelling from the airport by train. You need to get off at Maria Zambrano and keep going right out of station/shopping centre. The hotel has lovely clean modern lines. Reception staff were friendly helpful and efficient. We were on the 6th floor. the room was plenty big enough for a city break. It had the biggest bed I've ever slept in which was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was good with a fantastic shower with powerful jets. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel so can't comment on that.
reviews.title: modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We caught the bus into the centre of Malaga the first time to know the way, but walked there after, which took an enjoyable 10 to 15 mins. A good way to use up the calories from San Miguel and tapas! I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again on future trips to Malaga.
reviews.title: Great location, very modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Clean modern hotel right beside the main train station so it was handy travelling from the airport in only 8 minutes. Room was clean and the bed was very large and comfortable. Extensive choice at the breakfast buffet which we had one day as we wanted to make a very early start, but a bit expensive at €15 per person. Going down the slide is a must and is great fun feature. A couple of minor niggles like a loose plug in the bath and loud noise when others let their doors slam but nothing that spoiled our stay.
reviews.title: Ultra Modern Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel location is excellent if you are arriving by train or bus. The hotel can be accessed from the train staion and the bus station is adjacent. You can travel to and from the airport for €1.40. The waterfront is a short walk away. There are lots of eateries in the station which is also a shopping centre.
reviews.title: Good modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Can get almost to the door with a taxi from the airport, also handy for the main bus station. A wee 10 minute walk to the centre but worth that. Fabulous rooms, superb breakfast and really attentive helpful staff.
reviews.title: If you can stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed here several times and it never disappoints us. The staff are very friendly and speak excellent english, and check-in /check- out is very efficient. Modern hotel with good sized rooms. Well- equiped bathrooms with toiletries provided. The buffet breakfast is superb, and the slide from the restaurant down to the reception is always entertaining! Great location with a separate entrance in from the shopping mall and railway station, and just a two minute walk from the bus station. Takes about fifteen minutes to walk into the centre of Malaga, but being so near to the public transport is a big plus; makes arrival and departure so easy.
reviews.title: Love this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: All in all, a great hotel in a great location. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Not cheap but a good value; convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very nice. The price is by no means cheap but the room is worth the price. The hotel is right next to the main rail station and is the drop off/return point for all of the major car rental companies. We had driven from Madrid, so checking into the hotel and dropping off the car were easy. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the center of town. The breakfast is excellent. If you book with that option you get a pretty good deal. The room was clean and comfortable and the internet service worked very well.
reviews.title: Convenient for a weeekend break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just spent a weekend in Malaga and, with so little time, ease of access to this hotel was a real plus point. Within 50 minutes of touching down at the airport we were checking in. We only had hand luggage, got the train at the airport station (every 20 minutes all day - Euro1.40 from Mon-Fri and Euro 1.55 at weekends and holidays) and three stops and eight minutes later we were at Maria Zambrano railway station.
reviews.title: Good Serviceable Hotel
